profile.name: James Anderson
profile.aboutMe: Developer with a background in physics, mathematics and software development. Priorities client needs and AGILE development approach to determine optimal solutions.

experience.description: I am currently installing our inaugural Alfred H. Knight unit in Liverpool, England. With the AHK1-MAX32 installation, I am committed to delivering the recently developed mini-jar precision assay service for AHK. Being on-site for the first six months is crucial for the physics team, as it helps facilitate the introduction of this cutting-edge technology and advance the subsequent projects with AHK.

My self-guided front-end journey involves hands-on exploration of JavaScript, React, and Vue. I experiment with CSS, utilizing Flexbox and Grid layouts, and dive into creative light-dark UI designs. Netlify streamlines hosting, simplifying deployment as I refine my approach to crafting visually engaging interfaces, showcasing a commitment to staying current with evolving web technologies and a curiosity-driven design sensibility.

Led a month-long deployment in Bendigo, where I conducted a mini jar photon assay feasibility study and collaborated with Alfred H. Knight to streamline processing for smaller assay samples. Oversaw the successful deployment of the first external vertical transmission gauge (VTG) for photon assay

Traveling to Ravenswood, Queensland, located just outside Townsville, I led the Physics team in commissioning the thirteenth photon assay unit. This represented a significant milestone in my career, as I was tasked with deploying the first ever photon assay unit to a mine site independently. During my time on-site, I also implemented an environmental monitoring enclosure of my own design and seamlessly integrated it with the existing photon assay product.

My first work trip brought me to Kalgoorlie in Western Australia, where I marveled at the Kalgoorlie super pit. Guided by a colleague, we led the physics team in installing the tenth photon assay unit. Interestingly, my grandfather hails from this mining town, imbuing the journey with a sense of family heritage.

I was awaraded a reaserch scholarship with the Institute for Photonics and Advanced Sensing (IPAS) at the University of Adelaide. On this scholarship I developed a high temperature sensor, up to 1300 degrees, utilising refactive index shifts and fast fourir transform analysis.
Leaveraging my affinity for education I began tutoring in mathematics, physics and chemistry. Taking on four students at range of year levels I was proud to witness their acedmaic growth.
Operating through midnight and early morning shifts I supported the in and out flow of fresh goods.

education.course: Categorisations of Deadtime using High Purity Germanium Detectors and CAEN Multichannel Analysers
Advance Science with majors in Experimental and Theoretical Physics
Graduated with subjects in Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry and Geology. Ranking in the top 97 percentile.

freetime.description: I'm a movie lover, cruising through life with a mix of genres. Whether it's comedy, drama, or an unexpected twist, I navigate it all with a laid-back sense of humor. Friends call me a film critic, but I'm just a casual couch potato enjoying every scene. If we get talking I will eventually bring up Letterboxd.

Coffee, my daily joy in three cups. A cafe's mention beckons me, where each sip becomes a celebration. Rain or shine, I walk to my coffee haven, turning sipping into an extraordinary ritual, one cup at a time.

certificate.course: Licence to Operate Ionising Radiation Apparatus

project.name: Online Resume
project.description: A resume bulit using the Vue JS Framework. Record major milestone and advertise skill set.

project.name: Movie Index
project.description: A web application built using the React JS Framework. Look up movies, artwork and release dates.
